meanings.definition: Instruments that record variations in atmospheric pressure on a very small scale.
meanings.sent1: The microbarographs in the weather station help scientists track tiny changes in air pressure.
meanings.sent2: The researchers relied on the microbarographs to monitor the subtle shifts in atmospheric pressure.
meanings.sent3: During the experiment, the microbarographs started playing a melody each time the pressure changed.
meanings.sent4: The microbarographs acted like silent guardians, capturing the whispers of the air around them.
meanings.sent5: The delicate microbarographs painted a detailed picture of the ever-changing pressure in the atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure minute changes in barometric pressure.
meanings.sent1: The tiny microbarographs on the shelf helped the meteorologist detect small shifts in pressure.
meanings.sent2: Every morning, the technician checked the microbarographs to ensure accurate pressure readings.
meanings.sent3: The microbarographs seemed to have a secret mission to uncover the tiniest pressure changes.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the microbarographs hummed with anticipation of the impending pressure drop.
meanings.sent5: The microbarographs were like miniature detectives, solving the mystery of the subtle pressure variations.
